title: The Bank of England's Birth
description: A quick win: understand The Bank of England's Birth.

hook.text: England needed money for a war against France. A group of merchants had an idea.

buildup.text: In 1694, they lent the government 1.2 million pounds and received a banking charter in return.

twist.text: It became the model for every central bank that followed, from the Fed to the ECB.

climax.text: The world's most powerful financial institutions began as wartime fundraising schemes.

punchline.text: Central banking was born from war debt.

quiz.question: Why was the Bank of England originally created?
